page.title: 06ST. GILES CHURCH,WREXHAM
page.content: The recorded history of St. Giles church dates back to 1220 when it was closely associated with Valle Crucis Abbey near Llangollen. The West Tower, one of the Seven Wonders of Wales, was completed in 1520, so for over four centuries the tower of St. Giles Church standing at 136ft, has been the main feature of the towns skyline. During the Civil War, Paliamentary forces entered the church, melted down the organ pipes to make bullets and used the church building as a stable and prison. Of special interest to American visitors is the tomb in the churchyard of Elihu Yale, benefactor of Yale University U.S.A. A replica of St. Giles Church Tower forms part of Yale University buildings. Also associated with the church is Bishop Heber, who wrote the famous missionary hymn " From Greenlands Icy Mountains".
